pageContext.claim: “When Abraham Lincoln made the Gettysburg Address speech, the great speech, do you know he was ridiculed? He was ridiculed…. he was excoriated by the fake news. They had fake news then. He was excoriated. They said it was a terrible, terrible speech.”
pageContext.analysis: Reaction to Lincoln’s speech was divided along partisan lines. The New York Times, then Republican-leaning, praised it and printed it in the newspaper. Democratic-leaning publications were critical.
